summary: This is an email chain from April 2019 discussing coordination regarding a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. An attorney from Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP is reaching out to a contact, referencing a case number and a Special Agent, to discuss services available for their client.

persons.name: Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess
persons.role: Attorney (Associate at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP)
persons.context: Attorney who sends the initial outreach email on behalf of her client, a victim, to discuss available services. She is cc'ed on the final forwarded message.

persons.name: Alex Conlon
persons.role: Attorney (colleague at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP)
persons.context: Colleague of Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess, cc'ed on the initial outreach email to the recipient.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the 'trafficker' and the subject of the case. His name is provided as the case subject.

connections.description: Colleagues at the law firm Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP, working together on behalf of a client.
Hess is an attorney representing a victim in a case related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled call regarding victim services
events.description: A call is scheduled for 4pm to discuss services available for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 350 Fifth Avenue, Suite 7110, New York, New York (Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP office)
keyFacts: The document references a specific case number for Jeffrey Epstein: 31E-NY-3027571.
Attorneys from Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP are representing a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and are coordinating with a contact, possibly a victim services provider or law enforcement liaison.
The communication indicates an ongoing effort in April 2019 to secure services for a victim, showing post-arrest support activities.
A Special Agent is referenced as having provided the contact's name to the attorneys, indicating law enforcement involvement in victim support.
The email chain shows confusion about remembering the trafficker's name, which is clarified as Jeffrey Epstein.
